intro: Pappochroma pappocromum, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and rough, spiny stems. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to harsh, dry conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
